   "created_at": "2018-12-28T22:58:23Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2018-12-28T22:58:23Z",
   "body_snippet": "When importing connections from another format, credentials should be harvested and provided to the user just like the confCons upgrade process. Currently, they attempt to save the user/domain/password data directly to the connection record.",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-18",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "Connection importers currently populate credential fields directly; they should be updated to extract credentials into the Credential Manager (CredentialRepository) to promote centralization and reuse."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [],
   "comments_cursor": "2018-12-28T22:58:23Z",
   "unread_comments": 0,
   "needs_action": false,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): Connection importers currently populate credential fields directly; they should be updated to extract credentials into the Credential Manager (CredentialRepository) to promote centralization and reuse.\nApproach: Modify connection importers (e.g., Putty, RDCMan) to extract username/password/domain. Check if a matching CredentialRecord exists in the CredentialRepository; if not, create one. Link the imported ConnectionInfo to the CredentialRecord via ID instead of storing credentials directly."
 }
